most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
Unable to open Pieces Core Services

common_issues.title: PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop Startup Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop failing to start after updates.  Symptoms include "UnauthenticatedUserException", "Ensure Core Dependencies" errors, and multiple PiecesOS installations detected.  Reinstallation has not resolved the issue.  Potential solutions include verifying single PiecesOS installation and ensuring proper authentication.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
related_issues.text: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update. stucks at loading ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. For over a month I have been unable to use **Pieces OS** or **Pieces Desktop**. The Pieces OS service stopped working (I assume after the last update), and since then the desktop app no longer starts properly. Whenever I try to launch, the `Pieces` process starts but never progresses further. In **Pieces Desktop** I only see the message: _Ensure Core Dependencies Retry Step_ I’ve seen another user reporting a similar issue, but my case seems different (I’m attaching logs below). Unfortunately, this is not the first time I’ve faced problems with Pieces.... I’ve already lost all my history/snippets about three times in the past (distinct bugs). This situation is quite frustrating. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install/update to the latest version of Pieces OS on Windows 11. 2. Launch Pieces Desktop. 3. Observe that the app does not open and gets stuck with the “Ensure Core Dependencies” message. ### Expected Behavior Pieces OS should start normally and allow Pieces Desktop to connect and function. ### Actual Behavior - Pieces OS process starts but hangs. - Pieces Desktop shows “Ensure Core Dependencies – Retry Step”. - Reinstalling from scratch does not solve the issue. ### System Information - **OS**: Windows 11 - **Processor**: Intel x64-based - **Pieces OS**: 12.2.1.0 - **Pieces Desktop**: 4.34 ### Troubleshooting Attempted - Tried reinstalling Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop from scratch → issue persists. - I noticed a similar issue has been reported, but I’m not sure it is directly related to what I’m experiencing. - I suspect that completely deleting all local data/configuration files could be a final solution, but this would cause me to lose all my snippets/history (which has already happened before). I’d prefer to avoid this unless it’s confirmed as the only fix. ### Logs [Support logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22142467/Support.zip) ### Additional... If this issue is already being tracked, that’s fine. If not, I’ll attempt to wipe all Pieces data and retry, though I suspect some leftover files/data may be blocking the reinstall. Thanks in advance for your support! recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop Startup Failures" issue, given its high frequency and impact on users.
Investigate the root cause of the startup failures, focusing on authentication issues, multiple installations, and update processes.
Improve error messaging and troubleshooting steps for startup failures to guide users towards self-resolution.
Develop automated diagnostics to detect and resolve common startup issues.
Consider implementing a more robust update mechanism to minimize disruptions and ensure compatibility.
Proactively communicate with affected users and provide updates on the progress of the investigation and resolution.
